result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rhema A. Price

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on January 13, 2023 at 11:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Metro Market/co-actor listed in the Criminal Complaint. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

1:31 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Rhema A. Price in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Rhema A. Price. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 11:00 am.
